timeline.bodyText: I find this wrapping strange. We don't normally do that with builders when the reference is a simple variable.
timeline.author: electrum

replies.bodyText:
I use it in other places too
https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/d047f22f3801eaf60042921e089c5758898b6d9d/presto-product-tests-launcher/src/main/java/io/prestosql/tests/product/launcher/env/environment/MultinodeTls.java#L68-L70
also, the advantage of this is that code is copy-pastable between configureContainer and methods creating new container.
this is useful when eg setting some networking properties for both: new & existing containers
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: i have no hard feelings anyway. i am open, we can change it, if we want to
replies.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: It would be better to un-share these config files in a separate commit.
timeline.author: electrum

replies.bodyText: I agree. but the benefit is minimal, so let me not redo the history now.
replies.author: findepi
